member.name: T:Syncfusion.SfChart.iOS.SFChartBehavior
member.summary: SFChartBehavior can be added to SFChart view You can handle the SFChart view events directly in chart behavior, which will be helpful in designing the chart application.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfChart.iOS.SFChartBehavior.Chart
member.summary: Gets the chart.
member.value: The SFChart view the chart behavior is attached to. (read-only) You attach(or add) a chart behavior to a SFChart object using the Behavior collection property.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.SfChart.iOS.SFChartBehavior.AdornmentLayer
member.summary: Gets the adornment layer.
member.value: You can also add your drawing content to the Chart, by making use of the adornment layer. This method returned the adornment layer which can be used to place the your drawing content at desired positions.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.SfChart.iOS.SFChartBehavior.TouchesBegan(Foundation.NSSet,UIKit.UIEvent)
member.summary: Tells the receiver when one or more fingers touch down in a SFChart view.
member.param: A set of UITouch instances that represent the touches for the starting phase of the event represented by event.
An object representing the event to which the touches belong.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.SfChart.iOS.SFChartBehavior.TouchesMoved(Foundation.NSSet,UIKit.UIEvent)
member.summary: Tells the receiver when one or more fingers associated with an event move within a SFChart view.
member.param: A set of UITouch instances that represent the touches that are moving during the event represented by event.
An object representing the event to which the touches belong

member.name: M:Syncfusion.SfChart.iOS.SFChartBehavior.TouchesEnded(Foundation.NSSet,UIKit.UIEvent)
member.summary: Tells the receiver when one or more fingers are raised from a SFChart view.
member.param: A set of UITouch instances that represent the touches for the ending phase of the event represented by event.
An object representing the event to which the touches belong.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.SfChart.iOS.SFChartBehavior.TouchesCancelled(Foundation.NSSet,UIKit.UIEvent)
member.summary: Sent to the receiver when a system event (such as a low-memory warning) cancels a touch event.
member.param: A set of UITouch instances that represent the touches for the ending phase of the event represented by event.
An object representing the event to which the touches belong.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.SfChart.iOS.SFStackingBar100Series
member.summary: Represents a 100% stacked bar chart. To render this chart, create an instance of this class and add it to collection property and set the required properties.
member.remarks: SFStackingBar100Series is the transposed version of SFStackingColumn100Series. Unlike other cartesian chart types, to plot SFStackingBarSeries, x-axis will be rendered vertically and y-axis will be rendered horizontally. Hence, it is not possible to plot other chart types along with SFStackingBarSeries. Multiple SFStackingBarSeries can be added in a single . SFStackingBarSeries requires, and properties to be set to render the chart. This series also requires x-axis and y-axis to be explicitly set either using and or and .
